thread.title: Erin Holland wants something sparkly for Valentine's Day | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Erin Holland wants something sparkly for Valentine's Day | Daily Mail Online

author: Candice Jackson For Daily Mail Australia
title: Erin Holland wants something sparkly for Valentine's Day | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 438 shares Suggesting she wants jewellery from the retailer, The TV presenter displayed the stylish crystal encrusted headphones that comes as a gift when $200 is spent. Posing against the water, she held the headphones in her dainty hands as she sported earrings, a ring and bracelet from the retailer. 'BOYS!!!' She tagged her boyfriend, alongside his cricketing pal Usman Khawaja, in the post and ensured they got the hint by writing: 'BOYS!!! Looking at you' The actress wore a low-cut black top, while flaunting a full-face of makeup. Erin placed her blonde locks, styled in loose curls, in a high ponytail. Putting forward jewellery as a top gift idea, she said: 'Still struggling with #ValentinesDay gifts? There's only one place to go.' Never too many accessories! She suggested she wants jewellery from the retailer, as she promoted a stylish crystal encrusted headphone that you can only receive when you spend $200 or more with the reatiler Smitten! The loved-up couple have been dating for more than two years, having met through mutual friends The loved-up couple have been dating for more than two years, having met through mutual friends. Erin and Ben aren't living together though, as Erin splits her time between her home in Sydney and Brisbane, where Ben is based for Brisbane Heat, However, Ben also travels overseas during the year for the Indian Premier League as part of the Sunrisers Hyderabad team, where Erin usually visits. Making it work: While living separately interstate in Sydney and Brisbane, Erin ensures to split her time up between the two states Ben has proven himself as a powerful all-rounder in the game, and has a reputation as one of the biggest hitters in the Big Bash League. Despite his success, Erin has previously admitted to The Daily Telegraph she enjoys the game less these days as she worries about her boyfriend. 'I fear for how he will perform but also of him getting an injury as I know how much rides on every game and how hard they train and what it could mean if it goes well,' she explained. Lucky lady! Erin revealed the shiny red bike she received from boyfriend Ben for Christmas The former Miss World Australia previously credited 'talking everyday' for their successful long-distance romance. During an interview with cricket website, The Delivery , Erin confessed being separated has had it's moments but they've found ways to make the most of it 'The key is communication,' she admitted, adding: 'If you’re not talking everyday it’s tough.' Long-distance love! Erin has previously credited 'talking everyday' for the success behind her two-year long-distance romance with Ben Read more:
